p.s: The Tragedietragedy of Macbeth is a tragedy by William Shakespeare.
It is thought to have been first performed in 1609.
It dramatises the damaging physical and psychological effects of political ambition on those who seek power for its own sake.
A brave Scottish general named Macbeth receives a prophecy from a trio of witches that one day he will become King of Scotland.
Corrumped by ambition and spurred by his wife, Macbeth murders King Duncan and takes the Scottish throne for himself.

The following scene number seven of the first act deals with a conversation between Macbeth and his wife Lady Macbeth, where she tries to persuade Macbeth, that he must kill the actual King Duncan to fullfillfulfill his destiny.
At the beginning Macbeth meets his wife Lady Macbeth secretly after finishing the dinner in the chamber.
Macbeth states that he will not kill Duncan.
Lady Macbeth does not understand why Macbeth stops seeking for power and a better life, not only for himself, even for her because she thought he loves her.
At this point Macbeth wants to end the conversation and says that he will gain power with the time.
In the following Lady Macbeth states that she would do everything to gain power and improve both of their lifeslives.
Now she wants that Macbeth takes the chance to act the same way.
He begins to think about the possibility, but is still insecure.

However, Lady Macbeth starts to create a plan how they could kill King Duncan when he sleeps and make his chamberlains responsible for his death, because she will invite them to beer and wine so that they get drunk.
At the end Macbeth accepts the plan even if he is not secure by one-hundred percent.
